alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 11:14AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Bell, northeastern Knox, southern Owsley, western Leslie, western Perry and Clay Counties through NOON EDT... At 1114 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oneida, or 10 miles northeast of Manchester, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Panco around 1120 AM EDT. Enline, Jacks Creek, Hector and Sizerock around 1125 AM EDT. Peabody, Big Creek, Bear Branch, Bobs Fork, Boho and Goose Rock around 1130 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Marcum, Plank, Botto, Hosea, Creekville, Spring Creek, Lipps, Brightshade, Roark, Ashers Fork, Essie, Ice Cliff, Queendale, Skidmore, Asher, Gardner, Warbranch, Mozelle and Erose. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 22 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Clay; Knox; Leslie; Owsley; Perry
